archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection consists of architectural floorplans, photographs, building demographic surveys, and curriculum guides of secondary schools operating in Virginia as of 1995.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Scott Worner Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Scott Worner Collection, Ms1998-015, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Scott Worner Collection was donated to Special Collections in September 1998.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Scott Worner Papers commenced and was completed in 1998 by Brad Shearer, Student Assistant, and Laura Katz Smith, Manuscripts Curator. Additional accruals were processed by Kira A. Dietz, Processing and Acquisitions Archivist in 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Scott Worner collection consists of architectural floorplans, photographs, building demographic surveys, and curriculum guides of secondary schools operating in Virginia as of 1995. Worner collected this material as part of his research for his dissertation from the College of Education at Virginia Tech. His study resulted in "A Study of the Architecture and Curriculum of Virginia High Schools," his dissertation that was part of earning his Ph.D. in Educational Administration.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized alphabetically by name of school. While all of the 287 schools listed in the collection have building demographic surveys and floorplans, only 196 have photographs and 27 have curriculum guides. Additions processed in 2009 were placed at the end of the collection in Box 5.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Worner, Scott Charles. A Study of the Architecture and Curriculum of Virginia High Schools. Thesis (Ph. D.)—Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, 1995, 1995.
